result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale Lee Blaha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

Do not possess or consume alcohol.  Submit to evidentiary testing to monitor compliance.

Do not enter any bars, taverns, or establishments engaged in the primary purpose of the sale of alcohol.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete a 24- to 26-week domestic education class.

1 day credit in the event of revocation.

Costs remitted by the Court.
Concurrent with: 16CM49

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale Lee Blaha

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
16CM34 and 16CM49.  Defendant Dale Lee Blaha in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement details stated.  Def pleads guilty to count 3/dc in 16CM34 and to counts 1/intimidate victim and 5/bail jumping in 16CM49.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:

16CM49 - Counts 1 and 5 - 

Count 5 - 30 days jail with huber, stayed until on or before August 13, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

Count 1 and 16CM34 - withheld for probation of 18 months with conditions of AODA and follow through; no possess/consumption alcohol; no entry into bars/taverns/establishments that primarily sell alcohol; submit to testing to monitor compliance; attend, pay for, and succ. complete 24- to 26-wk d.a. class.  

Costs imposed in 16CM49 but not in 16CM34.

1 day credit on each case.

Remaining counts DRI.
Status conference on July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dale Lee Blaha in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
In person request from defense counsel to adjourn from 06/01/16 to 06/15/16. No objection by DA
Status conference on June 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

16CM49/initial and 16CM34/adjourned initial.  Defendant Dale Lee Blaha in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. W waives formal reading and enters NG pleas on def's behalf.  Court states charges and informs def of rights. Status requested and set for 6/1 at 1:30.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Dale Lee Blaha in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties as well as right to counsel. Court instructs def to contact SPD, resets date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
